Class PlayerName

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayerName
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PlayerName
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Creates a dialog to ask the player for their name and stores their name.
    Version:
    1.3, May 18, 2014
    Author:
    Richard Dang and Benson Guo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javax.swing.JButton continueButton
      Allows access to JButton methods.
      private javax.swing.JDialog d
      Allows access to JDialog methods.
      private java.awt.KeyEventDispatcher key
      Checks if the enter key has been pressed.
      (package private) static java.lang.String playerName
      Stores the player's name.
      private javax.swing.JTextField tField
      Allows access to JTextField methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerName()
      Class constructor that creates the name dialog, asks them for their name and sets up the enter key to allow them to continue.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
      Uses action listener to check if one of the buttons are pressed and performs the action assosiated with it.
      void continueToGame()
      Checks the player's name length and stores it if it is less than 10 characters long.
      void enterKey()
      Used to allow the user to continue to the game by clicking the enter button instead of using the mouse.
      void nameDialog()
      Creates the name dialog which includes a label asking the player for their name, a textfield for input and a button to continue to the game.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerName

        public PlayerName()
        Class constructor that creates the name dialog, asks them for their name and sets up the enter key to allow them to continue.

    • Method Detail

      • nameDialog

        public void nameDialog()
        Creates the name dialog which includes a label asking the player for their name, a textfield for input and a button to continue to the game.
        Parameters:
        nameLabel - JLabel: Allows access to JLabel methods.
        e - reference: Allows access to IOException methods.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indicate an error when importing the image.

      • enterKey

        public void enterKey()
        Used to allow the user to continue to the game by clicking the enter button instead of using the mouse.

      • continueToGame

        public void continueToGame()
        Checks the player's name length and stores it if it is less than 10 characters long. The dialog is closed after the name is accepted and the player goes to the game panel.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Uses action listener to check if one of the buttons are pressed and performs the action assosiated with it. During this time, the menu items are enabled. Continue allows the player to continue to the game.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - ActionEvent: allows access to ActionEvent methods
